title: SonarQube Issues Export - Complete Dataset

filesGenerated.description: Complete export with all 921 issues and 77 security hotspots
filesGenerated.contents: All issues categorized by type (reliability/maintainability/security) plus all security hotspots
Issues that affect system reliability and stability
Issues that affect code maintainability, readability, and technical debt
Security-sensitive code that needs manual review (11 high, 46 medium, 20 low probability)

filesGenerated.description: All issues organized by file (174 files)
filesGenerated.contents: Same issues as complete export but grouped by file for easier navigation
Overview statistics, top files with issues, data field descriptions

commonFields: key: Unique identifier for the issue
rule: SonarQube rule that triggered (e.g., typescript:S7772)
line: Line number where issue occurs
textRange: Exact position {startLine, endLine, startOffset, endOffset}
hotspotSpecific: securityCategory: Type of security concern (auth, injection, etc.)

usageNotes: All files are in JSON format and can be opened in any text editor or IDE
For large files, use a tool that can handle multi-MB JSON files
The textRange field gives you exact character positions to locate issues in source code
Issues with multiple impacts will appear in multiple categories
Security hotspots require manual review - they are not confirmed vulnerabilities
The "by file" organization makes it easy to work through issues file by file
Use the rule field to look up detailed rule documentation on SonarCloud
nextSteps: Review critical and major issues first
Check security hotspots (especially HIGH probability ones)
Use file paths and line numbers to locate issues in your codebase
Reference rule IDs on sonarcloud.io for detailed remediation guidance
Track progress by marking issues as resolved in SonarQube
